column5: Dog Mourns Owner  Saw this today and boy did it hit me. Man's true best friend, right till the end!
Gut wrenching!  Dogs are amazing animals.
Well if that doesn't bring a tear to your eye that image is one that no one in the gymnasium will ever forget such a sad yet amazing story thanks for sharing .
They are truly amazing animals. I have a Lab myself, and though still just a pup, he has already amazed me in many ways. Smart, loyal and unconditional love would sum up my Toby.
Yup dogs are pretty loyal check this story out  http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hachik%C5%8D
Dogs are definitely some of the most amazing animals on the planet, alot smarter than most of us give them credit for!

I gotta stop reading these things at work.They always get me teary. I always own 2 dogs. I find them more fun to watch when they play.My little Pom, was feeling ill, and my Lab would lick him and whine. A few weeks later his condition was getting worse, and se took him to the Vet.  He never came home Cancer of the spleen, and we had to let him go  Dang....there goes the eyes again.

Sorry to hear that Mercman, I have always felt like a dog is a part of the family  I have 2 little dogs as well, and grew up with a Lab (Bayly), my little guys just love Bayly and always try to lick the small sore on his eye, they actually have made it better! I am not looking forward to losing Bayly, he is 13 now, I don't even want to think about it

Thanks Bud. I should have mentioned that this happened a couple of years ago. We went out after the mourning period, and got another little Pom.I love Poms. Best watch dog around Thier squeeky little bark could wake up the dead

haha yeah, I had never had a small dog before these 2, a Yorkie/Dachshund (Dorkie) and a Chihuahua/Dachsund (Chiweenie) stupid names I know, but they are little characters, and they definitely wake up the neighbourhood with their barks!
